prompt: <description>Part 1: Constructing a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Step 1: Creating a Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0). Step 2: Drawing a 2D Sketch Draw the 2D sketch for the base of the prism on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch will contain a single face with four lines, forming a rectangle. - Line 1: Start Point (0, 0), End Point (0.375, 0) - Line 2: Start Point (0.375, 0), End Point (0.375, 0.75) - Line 3: Start Point (0.375, 0.75), End Point (0, 0.75) - Line 4: Start Point (0, 0.75), End Point (0, 0) Step 3: Scaling the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 4: Transforming the Sketch into 3D Extrude the scaled 2D sketch by a depth of 0.0015 units along the direction normal to the sketch. Part 2: Constructing a Cylindrical Object with a Hole Construct a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in the center. Step 1: Creating a Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.0175, 0.33, 0.0015). Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch for the Main Cylinder Draw the 2D sketch for the base of the main cylinder on face 1 of the coordinate system. The sketch will contain a single face with a circle. - Circle: Center (0.0075, 0.0075), Radius 0.0075 Step 3: Scaling the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.09. Step 4: Transforming the Sketch into 3D Extrude the scaled 2D sketch the main cylinder by a depth of 0.0125 units along the direction opposite to the normal of the sketch. Step 5: Drawing the 2D Sketch for the Hole Draw the 2D sketch for the hole on face 2 of the coordinate system. The sketch will contain a single face with a circle. - Circle: Center (0.0075, 0.0825), Radius 0.0075 Step 6: Scaling the Sketch Scale the 2D sketch for the hole by a factor of 0.09. Step 7: Transforming the Sketch into 3D Extrude the scaled 2D sketch for the hole by a depth of 0.0125 units along the direction opposite to the normal of the sketch. Final Result The resulting part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. The prism is centered on a white background. There is a cylindrical object with a smaller cylindrical hole in its center. The larger cylinder is positioned above the smaller one, which is slightly offset to the left. The objects are centered in the image.</description>
